description: Dive into "Coastal Escapes: Kobe's Beach Bliss" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Coastal Escapes: Kobe's Beach Bliss

places.generalDescription: Azur Maiko is a stunning artificial beach that offers a picturesque view of the Akashi Kaikyo Bridge. The calm waters make it perfect for swimming, although visitors should be cautious of the strong sunlight during summer days. It's advisable to bring a UV umbrella for protection. In the evening, the beach becomes an ideal spot to witness breathtaking sunsets and capture panoramic photographs.
places.name: Azur Maiko

reviews.text:
My favourite beach in the region!

No entry fee.
Near a train station.
Beautiful transparent cool waters.
Great views.
Free showers.
Shaded areas (free).
Coin lockers available.
Not crowded.
And it has a great super sento next to it!

The beach itself was fine - the seabed is rocky, and there's a bit of floating trash in the water, but nothing critical. What shocked me most was that a security guard came over and told us not to swim. This was September 14, it was 32¬∞C outside, the water was warm, and right nearby lifeguards were training. I asked him why, and he explained that the official swimming season had ended - it was open only until the end of August. The park is covered with thousands of prohibition signs, but not a single one mentioning this. So basically, you're not allowed to swim in perfect conditions just because the calendar says ‚Äúseason's over.‚Äù Absolutely ridiculous.

Beautiful beach with a gorgeous view of Akashi Kaikyo Bridge üåâ
Because there are almost no waves, The beach is comfortable for swimming üèä‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
But the strong direct sunlight might cause headache during the day in summer ‚òÄÔ∏è  Highly recommended to bring UV umbrella üåÇ for protection üëç in the evening, this place is the best spot for enjoying sunset üåá especially if you are enjoying taking panorama photography üì∏

places.generalDescription: Suma Seaside Park is a popular destination in Kobe, featuring an aquarium, amusement park, tennis courts, and a boardwalk. Adjacent to Suma Beach is the well-known Suma Aqualife Park, which has been entertaining visitors since 1957 with its diverse marine life and live animal performances. The park is conveniently located near a JR station and offers various activities such as wind surfing rentals. Visitors can also enjoy the nearby cafes and tiki-style bars for food and drinks.

sources.snippet: Right next to Suma Beach is another Kobe institution, the well-loved Suma Aqualife Park, which opened back in 1957!. It has its own convenient JR station minutes away and enough fish, dolphins, seals and live animal performances to keep young and old alike enthralled.

places.name: Suma Seaside Park

reviews.text: What more can you ask for? A seaside park that is well designed, clean and very spacious. Some eateries located along the stretch of the park. Starbucks, a children's playground and also a basketball court. We came on perfect day, full of sun and cool ocean breeze. Fantastic!
Great seaside park, open area with many places to go up to the surf. If you're lucky you might also spot jellyfish in the water. I saw 3 varieties in total, which was quite cool. Worth the visit!

We love Suma Seaside Park. The restaurants are wonderful. The beach is beautiful and clean. There are toilets very nice and clean. The great place to walk along the beach and enjoy the great view of ocean.

places.address: 1 Chome-Ôºì-1 Wakamiyacho, Suma Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 654-0049, Japan

places.generalDescription: BBQs pits & beach huts serving food on a stretch of coast popular for swimming & water sports.

sources.snippet: With its shallow waters and expansive shoreline, Hayashizaki Matsue Beach is perfect for swimming, fishing, and beachside barbecues. Accessible via a short train ride from Hayashisakimatsuekaigan Station, this family-friendly destination offers ample facilities including toilets, beach houses, and showers for added comfort. Check out our share house in Kobe, Sannomiya: Share House Palette Kobe Sannomiya

places.name: Hayashizaki Matsue Beach

reviews.text: Enjoying a BBQ with grilled meat and chicken after a swim in the sea is a dream, and at Hayashizaki Beach in Kobe, that dream becomes a reality.
Beautiful open beach with possibility to make barbecue.

Good place to relax. Good for kids as beach not too deep, aim for the low tide of you're gonna bring toddlers, perfect place for them to splash around.
Summer has 2 beach houses with food and beers etc.
BBQ is possible in the BBQ areas on the beach. Has new toilets and and outdoor shower as well.
Good safe beach to enjoy with the kids, probably the best kids beach around the area and a nice place to chill for adults too.
About 10 minutes walk from hayashizaki Matsue kaigan station on the sanyo line and there is also ample parking available for a around a thousand yen for the whole day.

places.generalDescription: Suma Beach is a family-friendly destination located less than 15 minutes away from Sannomiya by train. It offers 1.5km of sandy shoreline, with dining options, bars, and showers available for beachgoers. Adjacent to the beach is the popular Suma Aqualife Park, which features various marine life and live animal performances. The area's heavy industry and Chinatown are rooted in Kobe's significance as a port city on Osaka Bay.

sources.snippet: Check out Suma Beach, less than 15 minutes by train from Sannomiya, for a family-friendly day or evening on 1.5km of sand, featuring dining, bars, showers and anything else beachgoers could want. Right next to Suma Beach is another Kobe institution, the well-loved Suma Aqualife Park, which opened back in 1957!. It has its own convenient JR station minutes away and enough fish, dolphins, seals and live animal performances to keep young and old alike enthralled.

Conveniently located just steps away from JR Suma Station, Suma Beach welcomes visitors with its white sand. A beach volleyball game with friends or a leisurely stroll along the shoreline are some of the activities you can enjoy in Suma Beach. Nearby amenities include shops for snacks and drinks, as well as restrooms and shower facilities for added convenience.
If the mountain air is too much, take a trip down to Suma Beach, one of the Kansai region‚Äôs best beaches.

places.name: Suma Beach

reviews.text:
Suma Beach in Kobe is a popular destination for both locals and tourists looking to relax by the sea, especially during the summer months. I recently visited this beach and had a great experience overall, though there are some points to keep in mind before planning a trip.

The beach is easily accessible, just a short walk from Suma Station on the JR Kobe Line, making it convenient for those traveling from Osaka or Kobe. Upon arrival, I was impressed by the long stretch of sandy shoreline and the beautiful view of the Seto Inland Sea. The water was calm and warm, making it ideal for swimming, though it may not be the clearest compared to beaches in Okinawa or Shikoku.

One of the highlights of Suma Beach is its lively atmosphere during summer. Beachside restaurants and bars set up temporary stalls, serving delicious seafood, yakitori, and refreshing drinks. Many people were enjoying BBQs, playing beach volleyball, or simply relaxing under umbrellas. The music and entertainment from nearby beach clubs also added to the vibrant energy of the place.

However, one downside is that the beach can get quite crowded, especially on weekends. Finding a good spot might be challenging if you arrive late in the day. Additionally, while the beach is generally clean, some areas can have litter left behind by visitors, which slightly takes away from the natural beauty. The city does make efforts to clean the area, but more awareness among visitors would help maintain the beach better.

If you're looking for a fun and social beach experience close to Kobe, Suma Beach is a great option. It's perfect for a day of swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying the summer vibes. However, if you prefer a quieter, more pristine beach, you might want to explore nearby Awaji Island or other parts of the Seto Inland Sea.

Many local especially students like to come here before sunset. Not recommended for tourist to purposely visit the beach. The view is good but not the place to play sand. If you visit the park nearby then can stop by here before sunset.

As a foreigner with a couple smallish tattoos in my leg, this was confusing. We entered on the northern side, the walked along the beach, past a rope. No signs anywhere. We then went towards the walk way to leave and we're stopped by 2 workers telling us to cover my tattoos. We then saw signs with rules.
There were no signs along the beach as we walked to warn us. Apparently during the summer for 6 weeks they mark off a specific area for Smile Beach with strict rule enforcement. If we stayed on the other side of the rope we'd be fine. That's what we were told I think, and saw others there with tattoos.

But then along the walkway I saw a map a rule sign which said Google translate uses) don't intimidate others, including showing tattoos on the beach. But yet others were there with tattoos on the beach. So I think as long as you avoid the roped off area you should be fine.

places.address: 1 Chome-9 Wakamiyacho, Suma Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 654-0049, Japan

places.generalDescription: Azur Maiko Park is a stunning coastal park located in west Kobe, featuring an 800-meter long artificial beach with white sandy shores and a picturesque boardwalk offering views of the majestic Akashi Kaikyo Bridge. The park offers various facilities including a BBQ area perfect for small social gatherings, fishing spots, and even a golf course. Visitors can enjoy picnicking, swimming, seaside strolls, and breathtaking sunsets at this popular destination.

sources.snippet: For a picturesque view of the Akashi Kaikyo Bridge, head to Azur Maiko Beach. This sandy stretch offers opportunities for beachside barbecues, sea fishing, and even a refreshing dip in the ocean. As night falls, marvel at the bridge illuminated in a spectrum of rainbow colors, creating a unique ambiance along the shore.

Azur Maiko is a beautiful beach, once again without many people around. It's a wonderful place to sit and relax, and even go for a swim on the warm summer days. ‚òÄÔ∏è #kobejapan #japan #japantrip #mytravelhacks #historicallandmarks #localguides #familytrip #summerdestinations
sources.shortName: Kobe's Most Beautiful Beach in Maiko, Japan üáØüáµ
